resources.string: What pets are you interested in?
How much time do you spend at work/school per week?

In the United States, about 6.3 million stray animals enter shelters each year. Additionally, approximately 920,000 of those shelter animals are euthanized annually (ASPCA 2021). Animals are commonly abandoned or relinquished due to issues including allergies and the adopter being unprepared for care and costs (Weiss et al., 2015). Different pets and animals require different levels of care and financial capabilities, which makes choosing the correct pet difficult for many potential adopters. Unfit owners can cause detrimental effects such as neglect or abuse to their pets.

Furthermore, the global COVID-19 pandemic caused an increase in pet purchasing and adoption as individuals desired a companion for the time spent at home. However, as the world continues to return to a more in-person model, pet owners have less time to dedicate to their dependents. Their animals are no longer given the attention or time required, causing a recent uptick in pets relinquished or given away (PetPoint, n.d.). While the number of surrendered pets had been decreasing annually, the number of cats and dogs surrendered increased from 2020 to 2021.

Our app aims to address this problem and the ever growing need for good homes for animals. We hope to match each user with the appropriate animal for them and allow them to create a customizable preference profile which inputs the user’s data into an algorithm. This algorithm uses the user’s input along with data about different pet types to make a prediction of the pet type that would best suit the user’s needs and circumstances. The data used in this algorithm was collected from surveys and online resources. By using quantitative data to make pet recommendations, we aim to reduce pet homelessness and give owners a companion they need that can best compliment their owners’ situations.
